elements.name: panel1
elements.title: What is the key figure or technical term described?

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Corresponds to the value of all goods and services sold, i.e. the amount of money received.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: These are discounts that are granted to customers.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Costs incurred through the operation of a business. They cannot be directly allocated to a specific item.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Is the number (quantity) of items sold in a specific time period.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: What is the key figure or technical term described?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Corresponds to the difference between revenue and cost of goods sold.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: This is the amount of money that the company actually receives from the sale.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: These are products that are offered at reduced prices because they need to be sold as quickly as possible.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Indicates the stock level in units or francs at which the goods must be reordered and thus determines the time of reassortment.

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: What is the key figure or technical term described?

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Products that are returned by customers.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Shows how often the average stock is renewed (sold) per year.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: Refers to the positive amount that remains when the total costs (expenses) are deducted from the total income (revenue).
